CVE-2025-22495
(8.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-24T18:32:48

1 posts

An improper input validation vulnerability was discovered in the NTP server configuration field of the Network-M2 card. This could result in an authenticated high privileged user having the ability to execute arbitrary commands. The vulnerability has been resolved in the version 3.0.4. Note - Network-M2 has been declared end-of-life in early 2024 and Network-M3 has been released as a fit-and-func

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-24T17:33:56.000Z ##

I love NTP vulns for reasons and a forever-day is even better. Granted, this one appears to be post-auth, but given where Eaton devices tend to be used, it might be a good one to keep in the back pocket.

sev:HIGH 8.4 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:R/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H

https://www.eaton.com/content/dam/eaton/company/news-insights/cybersecurity/security-bulletins/etn-va-2025-1004.pdf

An improper input validation vulnerability was discovered in the NTP server configuration field of the Network-M2 card. This could result in an authenticated high privileged user having the ability to execute arbitrary commands. The vulnerability has been resolved in the version 3.0.4. Note - Network-M2 has been declared end-of-life in early 2024 and Network-M3 has been released as a fit-and-functional replacement.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-22495

CVE-2025-25279
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-24T18:28:17

1 posts

Mattermost versions 10.4.x <= 10.4.1, 9.11.x <= 9.11.7, 10.3.x <= 10.3.2, 10.2.x <= 10.2.2 fail to properly validate board blocks when importing boards which allows an attacker could read any arbitrary file on the system via importing and exporting a specially crafted import archive in Boards.

1 repos

https://github.com/numanturle/CVE-2025-25279

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-24T15:18:33.000Z ##

Mattermost released a security advisory last week but there are no details besides the CVEs.

https://mattermost.com/security-updates/

Details on the security update will be posted here on March 21 as per our Responsible Disclosure Policy.

So here are some descriptions on the three sev:CRIT vulns I see:

sev:CRIT 9.6 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:N

Mattermost versions 10.4.x <= 10.4.1, 9.11.x <= 9.11.7, 10.3.x <= 10.3.2, 10.2.x <= 10.2.2 fail to use prepared statements in the SQL query of boards reordering which allows an attacker to retrieve data from the database, via a SQL injection when reordering specially crafted boards categories.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-24490

sev:CRIT 9.9 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H

Mattermost versions 10.4.x <= 10.4.1, 9.11.x <= 9.11.7, 10.3.x <= 10.3.2, 10.2.x <= 10.2.2 fail to properly validate input when patching and duplicating a board, which allows a user to read any arbitrary file on the system via duplicating a specially crafted block in Boards.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-20051

sev:CRIT 9.9 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H

Mattermost versions 10.4.x <= 10.4.1, 9.11.x <= 9.11.7, 10.3.x <= 10.3.2, 10.2.x <= 10.2.2 fail to properly validate board blocks when importing boards which allows an attacker could read any arbitrary file on the system via importing and exporting a specially crafted import archive in Boards.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-25279

CVE-2025-1632
(3.3 LOW)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-24T15:30:49

1 posts

A vulnerability was found in libarchive up to 3.7.7. It has been classified as problematic. This affects the function list of the file bsdunzip.c. The manipulation leads to null pointer dereference. It is possible to launch the attack on the local host. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-24T15:13:43.000Z ##

Apparently there's a null pointer dereference vuln in libarchive up to 3.7.7 that has been ignored by the vendor. There's a supposed PoC zip file published but I don't have the time or fucks to dig into it right now.

https://github.com/Ekkosun/pocs/blob/main/bsdunzip-poc

A vulnerability was found in libarchive up to 3.7.7. It has been classified as problematic. This affects the function list of the file bsdunzip.c. The manipulation leads to null pointer dereference. It is possible to launch the attack on the local host. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-1632

(6.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-22T18:31:31

1 posts

A vulnerability in the SecureROM of some Apple devices can be exploited by an unauthenticated local attacker to execute arbitrary code upon booting those devices. This vulnerability allows arbitrary code to be executed on the device. Exploiting the vulnerability requires physical access to the device: the device must be plugged in to a computer upon booting, and it must be put into Device Firmware

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-21T22:28:02.000Z ##

Oh look, Apple finally published a CVE for Checkm8. If that seems like it came out a lifetime ago, it's because it did. The original advisory was published in 2019.

updated 2025-02-22T09:32:07

4 posts

The IP2Location Country Blocker plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Regular Information Exposure in all versions up to, and including, 2.38.8 due to missing capability checks on the admin_init() function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to view the plugin's settings.

CVE-2025-1510
(7.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2025-02-22T06:30:43

4 posts

The The Custom Post Type Date Archives plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to arbitrary shortcode execution in all versions up to, and including, 2.7.1. This is due to the software allowing users to execute an action that does not properly validate a value before running do_shortcode. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary shortcodes.

updated 2025-02-22T00:34:51

1 posts

Nagios XI 2024R1.2.2 is susceptible to a stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the Tools page. This flaw allows an attacker to inject malicious scripts into the Tools interface, which are then stored and executed in the context of other users accessing the page.

The Github pages say the mitigation is to "Update to the latest version" so I assume that there is a patched version. But I don't run Nagios so I can't be bothered to look.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-54959

Nagios XI 2024R1.2.2 is vulnerable to a Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) attack through the Favorites component, enabling POST-based Cross-Site Scripting (XSS).

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-54960

A SQL Injection vulnerability in Nagios XI 2024R1.2.2 allows a remote attacker to execute SQL injection via a crafted payload in the History Tab component.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-54961

Nagios XI 2024R1.2.2 is susceptible to a stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the Tools page. This flaw allows an attacker to inject malicious scripts into the Tools interface, which are then stored and executed in the context of other users accessing the page.

The attack can be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the publi

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-21T15:13:16.000Z ##

sev:CRIT PreAuth command injection in Raisecom gateways.

A vulnerability was found in Raisecom Multi-Service Intelligent Gateway up to 20250208. It has been declared as critical. This vulnerability affects unknown code of the file /vpn/vpn_template_style.php of the component Request Parameter Handler. The manipulation of the argument stylenum leads to os command injection. The attack can be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-1536

The manipulation leads to stack-based buffer overflow. The attack may be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. This vulnerability only affects products that are no longer s

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-21T15:16:28.000Z ##

Here's a couple sev:CRIT forever-days in the EoL D-Link DAP-1320.

A vulnerability classified as critical was found in D-Link DAP-1320 1.00. Affected by this vulnerability is the function set_ws_action of the file /dws/api/. The manipulation leads to heap-based buffer overflow. The attack can be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. This vulnerability only affects products that are no longer supported by the maintainer.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-1538

PoC: https://tasty-foxtrot-3a8.notion.site/D-link-DAP-1320-set_ws_action-Vulnerability-1950448e61958049be3cc606d434bc9d

A vulnerability, which was classified as critical, has been found in D-Link DAP-1320 1.00. Affected by this issue is the function replace_special_char of the file /storagein.pd-XXXXXX. The manipulation leads to stack-based buffer overflow. The attack may be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. This vulnerability only affects products that are no longer supported by the maintainer.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-1539

##

CVE-2025-24893
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2025-02-20T22:53:33

1 posts

### Impact Any guest can perform arbitrary remote code execution through a request to `SolrSearch`. This impacts the confidentiality, integrity and availability of the whole XWiki installation. To reproduce on an instance, without being logged in, go to `<host>/xwiki/bin/get/Main/SolrSearch?media=rss&text=%7D%7D%7D%7B%7Basync%20async%3Dfalse%7D%7D%7B%7Bgroovy%7D%7Dprintln%28"Hello%20from"%20%2B%2

Nuclei template

1 repos

https://github.com/iSee857/CVE-2025-24893-PoC

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-20T19:59:29.000Z ##

sev:CRIT RCE in XWiki. Per Shodan, there are a few hundred of those on the public Internet including some that may be interesting for, uh, researchers.

CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/security/advisories/GHSA-rr6p-3pfg-562j

XWiki Platform is a generic wiki platform offering runtime services for applications built on top of it. Any guest can perform arbitrary remote code execution through a request to SolrSearch. This impacts the confidentiality, integrity and availability of the whole XWiki installation. To reproduce on an instance, without being logged in, go to <host>/xwiki/bin/get/Main/SolrSearch?media=rss&text=%7D%7D%7D%7B%7Basync%20async%3Dfalse%7D%7D%7B%7Bgroovy%7D%7Dprintln%28"Hello%20from"%20%2B%20"%20search%20text%3A"%20%2B%20%2823%20%2B%2019%29%29%7B%7B%2Fgroovy%7D%7D%7B%7B%2Fasync%7D%7D%20. If there is an output, and the title of the RSS feed contains Hello from search text:42, then the instance is vulnerable. This vulnerability has been patched in XWiki 15.10.11, 16.4.1 and 16.5.0RC1. Users are advised to upgrade. Users unable to upgrade may edit Main.SolrSearchMacros in SolrSearchMacros.xml on line 955 to match the rawResponse macro in macros.vm#L2824 with a content type of application/xml, instead of simply outputting the content of the feed.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-24893

A vulnerability, that could result in Remote Code Execution (RCE), has been found in DocsGPT. Due to improper parsing of JSON data using eval() an unauthorized attacker could send arbitrary Python code to be executed via /api/remote endpoint. This issue affects DocsGPT: from 0.8.1 through 0.12.0.

CVE-2025-0108
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 96.76%

updated 2025-02-20T03:32:03

5 posts

An authentication bypass in the Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software enables an unauthenticated attacker with network access to the management web interface to bypass the authentication otherwise required by the PAN-OS management web interface and invoke certain PHP scripts. While invoking these PHP scripts does not enable remote code execution, it can negatively impact integrity and confidentiality

jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-20T11:10:53.000Z ##

Palo Alto Networks warns that a file read vulnerability (CVE-2025-0111) is now being chained in attacks with two other flaws (CVE-2025-0108 with CVE-2024-9474) to breach PAN-OS firewalls in active attacks. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/palo-alto-networks-tags-new-firewall-bug-as-exploited-in-attacks/

##
DarkWebInformer@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-19T22:49:50.000Z ##

🚨 High Security Vulnerability
🆔 CVE-2025-0108
💣 CVSS Score: 8.8
📅 Published Date: 25/02/12
⚠️ Details: An authentication bypass in the Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software enables an unauthenticated attacker with network access to the management web interface to bypass the authentication otherwise required by the PAN-OS management web interface and invoke certain PHP scripts. While invoking these PHP scripts does not enable remote code execution, it can negatively impact integrity and confidentiality of PAN-OS. You can greatly reduce the risk of this issue by restricting access to the management web interface to only trusted internal IP addresses according to our recommended best practices deployment guidelines

https://live.paloaltonetworks.com/t5/community-blogs/tips-amp-tricks-how-to-secure-the-management-access-of-your-palo/ba-p/464431 .

This issue does not affect Cloud NGFW or Prisma Access software.

NIST: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0108
Reference: https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2025-0108

Palo Alto Networks warns that hackers are actively exploiting a critical authentication bypass flaw (CVE-2025-0108) in PAN-OS firewalls, chaining...

updated 2025-02-20T00:32:11

An improper access control vulnerability in Power Pages allows an unauthorized attacker to elevate privileges over a network potentially bypassing the user registration control. Affected customers have been given instructions on reviewin

##
0x40k@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-20T07:22:05.000Z ##

Okay folks, Microsoft's at it again with the patches! This time, Bing and Power Pages are in the hot seat. Remote Code Execution and privilege escalation – sounds like a party for attackers, but definitely not for us defenders! 😅

First up, CVE-2025-21355 (Bing): We're talking Remote Code Execution here! Microsoft says they've fixed it server-side, but still, it's always best to stay vigilant and double-check your systems. You can never be too careful!

Then we have CVE-2025-24989 (Power Pages): Exploitation detected, with privilege escalation as the main course. Microsoft's already notified affected customers, so take a peek at your inbox just in case!

You know, permissions are often the name of the game in security. Get 'em wrong, and you're basically leaving the door wide open. So, check those logs, keep an eye out for any weird activity – it's seriously important! Automated scans are great and all, but let's be real, a proper pentest will always dig up more dirt.

So, how are you all securing your web applications? Got any best practices you'd like to share with the rest of us? I'm all ears! Let's swap some knowledge!

#infosec #pentest #security #microsoft

0x40k@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-20T07:22:05.000Z ##

Okay folks, Microsoft's at it again with the patches! This time, Bing and Power Pages are in the hot seat. Remote Code Execution and privilege escalation – sounds like a party for attackers, but definitely not for us defenders! 😅

First up, CVE-2025-21355 (Bing): We're talking Remote Code Execution here! Microsoft says they've fixed it server-side, but still, it's always best to stay vigilant and double-check your systems. You can never be too careful!

Then we have CVE-2025-24989 (Power Pages): Exploitation detected, with privilege escalation as the main course. Microsoft's already notified affected customers, so take a peek at your inbox just in case!

You know, permissions are often the name of the game in security. Get 'em wrong, and you're basically leaving the door wide open. So, check those logs, keep an eye out for any weird activity – it's seriously important! Automated scans are great and all, but let's be real, a proper pentest will always dig up more dirt.

So, how are you all securing your web applications? Got any best practices you'd like to share with the rest of us? I'm all ears! Let's swap some knowledge!

##
0x40k@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-20T07:14:36.000Z ##

Okay folks, Citrix and NetScaler... sound familiar to anyone else? 😅 Guess what? Another vulnerability alert! This time it's a Privilege Escalation (CVE-2024-12284) in the Console/Agent. Ouch! If someone gets in, they could snag more permissions than they're supposed to.

Here’s what’s affected:

* Version 14.1 before 14.1-38.53
* Version 13.1 before 13.1-56.18

So, what should you do? Update ASAP to 14.1-38.53+ or 13.1-56.18+! No workarounds this time, unfortunately.

As a pentester, I hate to say it, but I see this kind of thing *all* the time: incorrect permissions are like hitting the jackpot for attackers. 🤦 So please, check your NetScalers! And remember, you've gotta do regular pentests! "Security by Design" isn't just a buzzword, it's a necessity.

How are you securing your NetScaler environments? Any experiences with this patch you'd like to share? Let me know below! 👇

#infosec #pentest #citrix #netscaler

##

CVE-2025-0624
(7.7 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-19T21:31:44

1 posts

A flaw was found in grub2. During the network boot process, when trying to search for the configuration file, grub copies data from a user controlled environment variable into an internal buffer using the grub_strcpy() function. During this step, it fails to consider the environment variable length when allocating the internal buffer, resulting in an out-of-bounds write. If correctly exploited, th

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-19T21:04:00.000Z ##

I guess technically it's grub_strcpy() but close enough.

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2346112

A flaw was found in grub2. During the network boot process, when trying to search for the configuration file, grub copies data from a user controlled environment variable into an internal buffer using the grub_strcpy() function. During this step, it fails to consider the environment variable length when allocating the internal buffer, resulting in an out-of-bounds write. If correctly exploited, this issue may result in remote code execution through the same network segment grub is searching for the boot information, which can be used to by-pass secure boot protections.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0624

Does anyone have any more info on this one?

https://www.dell.com/support/kbdoc/en-us/000258429/dsa-2025-021

sev:HIGH 8.2 - CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H

Dell Client Platform BIOS contains a Weak Authentication vulnerability. A high privileged attacker with local access could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to Elevation of Privileges.

What constitutes a high privileged attacker with local access when you're talking about a BIOS vuln, especially when the vulnerability specifically leads to EoP?

CVE-2023-47160
(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2025-02-19T18:32:30

1 posts

IBM Cognos Controller 11.0.0 through 11.0.1 FP3 and IBM Controller 11.1.0 is vulnerable to an XML External Entity Injection (XXE) attack when processing XML data. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to expose sensitive information or consume memory resources.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-19T16:17:00.000Z ##

Several IBM Cognos Controller vulns and I don't use it but the hardcoded creds caught my eye.

https://www.ibm.com/support/pages/node/7183597

There are vulnerabilities in IBM® Java™, IBM® Websphere Application Server Liberty and Open-Source Software (OSS) components used by IBM Cognos Controller. Additionally, IBM Cognos Controller has addressed vulnerabilities that could lead to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)(CVE-2024-28776), XML External Entity Injection (XXE)(CVE-2023-47160), Unauthorized access (CVE-2024-52902), Incorrect Authorization (CVE-2024-45081), Unrestricted Deserialization (CVE-2024-28777), Decrypt Highly Sensitive Information (CVE-2024-28780) and Formula Injection (CVE-2024-45084). Please refer to the table in the Related Information section for vulnerability impact. This Security Bulletin relates only to the direct usage of third-party components by IBM Cognos Controller and not any nested dependencies within the product.

CVE-2025-26465
(6.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-19T15:33:13

3 posts

A vulnerability was found in OpenSSH when the VerifyHostKeyDNS option is enabled. A machine-in-the-middle attack can be performed by a malicious machine impersonating a legit server. This issue occurs due to how OpenSSH mishandles error codes in specific conditions when verifying the host key. For an attack to be considered successful, the attacker needs to manage to exhaust the client's memory re

2 repos

https://github.com/dolutech/patch-manual-CVE-2025-26465-e-CVE-2025-26466

client.

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2025-02-19T16:50:01.000Z ##

CVE-2025-26465 & CVE-2025-26466 Vulnerabilities Expose Systems to Man-in-the-Middle and DoS Attacks – Source: socprime.com https://ciso2ciso.com/cve-2025-26465-cve-2025-26466-vulnerabilities-expose-systems-to-man-in-the-middle-and-dos-attacks-source-socprime-com/ #rssfeedpostgeneratorecho #CyberSecurityNews #cve-2025-26465 #cve-2025-26466 #Latestthreats #Vulnerability #socprimecom #socprime #Blog #CVE

##
BenjaminHCCarr@hachyderm.io at 2025-02-19T15:26:00.000Z ##

New #OpenSSH flaws expose #SSH servers to #MiTM and #DoS attacks
The MiTM vulnerability, tracked under CVE-2025-26465, was introduced in December 2014 with the release of OpenSSH 6.8p1, so the issue remained undetected for over a decade. The flaw affects OpenSSH clients when the '#VerifyHostKeyDNS' option is enabled.
The denial of service vulnerability is CVE-2025-26466, a pre-authentication denial of service flaw introduced in OpenSSH 9.5p1, released in August 2023.
https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/new-openssh-flaws-expose-ssh-servers-to-mitm-and-dos-attacks/

CVE-2024-13483
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2025-02-19T12:31:51

1 posts

CVE-2022-35202
(5.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-13T18:33:33

3 posts

A security issue in Sitevision version 10.3.1 and older allows a remote attacker, in certain (non-default) scenarios, to gain access to the private keys used for signing SAML Authn requests. The underlying issue is a Java keystore that may become accessible and downloadable via WebDAV. This keystore is protected with a low-complexity, auto-generated password.

##
0x40k@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-21T09:10:24.000Z ##

Whoa, Salt Typhoon is back in action! 🤯 Can you believe they were lurking undetected in US telcos for a whole three years? It looks like they used CVE-2018-0171 (Cisco Smart Install) and some stolen credentials to get in. And then? Living off the Land (LOTL) like pros!

Seriously, telcos as stepping stones? Supply-chain attack vibes, anyone? 🤦‍♂️ This just goes to show you: Patch management *has* to be on point, MFA is a *must*, and threat hunting? Well, that's *definitely* not just a "nice-to-have" anymore.

Hey, have you folks seen anything similar out there? Let's chat! #infosec #pentest #apt

updated 2025-01-24T00:31:57

Variable response times in the AWS Sign-in IAM user login flow allowed for the use of brute force enumeration techniques to identify valid IAM usernames in an arbitrary AWS account.

##

CVE-2025-23209
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.90%

updated 2025-01-21T19:48:38

5 posts

### Impact This is an RCE vulnerability that affects Craft 4 and 5 installs where your security key has already been compromised. https://craftcms.com/knowledge-base/securing-craft#keep-your-secrets-secret Anyone running an unpatched version of Craft with a compromised security key is affected. ### Patches This has been patched in Craft 5.5.8 and 4.13.8. ### Workarounds If you can't update

ClubTeleMatique@mstdn.social at 2025-02-21T10:15:45.000Z ##

Hacker News: CISA Flags Craft CMS Vulnerability CVE-2025-23209 Amid Active Attacks https://thehackernews.com/2025/02/cisa-flags-craft-cms-vulnerability-cve.html #news #IT

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2025-02-21T09:25:02.000Z ##

CISA Flags Craft CMS Vulnerability CVE-2025-23209 Amid Active Attacks https://thehackernews.com/2025/02/cisa-flags-craft-cms-vulnerability-cve.html

##
0x40k@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-21T09:20:28.000Z ##

Okay, folks, listen up! Craft CMS users, this is a HUGE heads-up! 🚨 CISA just added CVE-2025-23209 to their Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) list. Remote Code Execution (RCE) is a real threat! 🤯

If you're running Craft CMS (versions 4 & 5, specifically anything before 4.13.8 or 5.5.8), you've gotta update, like, NOW! Seriously, code injection isn't a game. RCE means an attacker can basically take complete control of your system. Think of it as someone waltzing into your house and doing whatever they want! It's that serious.

Worried your security key might be compromised? 💥 That's a worst-case scenario! If that's the case, rotate your keys ASAP! Patching is definitely the better solution, no doubt. But here's the real question: How were those keys stolen in the first place? That's what we need to figure out!

Automated scans are great, but let's be honest, a proper penetration test is what *really* uncovers these kinds of vulnerabilities. Our clients are always thrilled when we catch stuff like this before it becomes a major problem. 😊 IT security isn't just a "nice-to-have," it's absolutely essential for protecting your business.

So, I'm curious: What CMS are you guys using, and what steps are you taking to keep it secure? 🤔 Share your thoughts!

#infosec #pentest #craftcms #rce #cisa

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2025-02-21T08:35:02.000Z ##

CISA Flags Craft CMS Vulnerability CVE-2025-23209 Amid Active Attacks https://thehackernews.com/2025/02/cisa-flags-craft-cms-vulnerability-cve.html

CVE-2024-53197(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-27T15:32:03

4 posts

In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ALSA: usb-audio: Fix potential out-of-bound accesses for Extigy and Mbox devices A bogus device can provide a bNumConfigurations value that exceeds the initial value used in usb_get_configuration for allocating dev->config. This can lead to out-of-bounds accesses later, e.g. in usb_destroy_configuration.

0x40k at 2025-02-28T19:10:02.510Z ##

Whoa, Cellebrite used a zero-day exploit against Android? Seriously? And get this - it was against an activist. As a pentester, I've gotta say, that's seriously messed up. Zero-days are like, the holy grail of vulnerabilities. The vendor's clueless, and attackers? They've got a free pass.

So, jot down these CVE numbers: CVE-2024-53104, CVE-2024-53197, CVE-2024-50302. This just goes to show you how crucial those updates really are! And let's be real, USB ports? Total risk factor.

Makes you wonder, doesn't it? How secure are our phones *really*? And hey, what steps do *you* take to stay protected? Let's chat about it.

#security #pentest #android

##
xairy at 2025-02-28T15:50:43.948Z ##

(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.36%

updated 2024-12-20T18:32:23

1 posts

Jenkins has a built-in command line interface (CLI) to access Jenkins from a script or shell environment. Jenkins uses the args4j library to parse command arguments and options on the Jenkins controller when processing CLI commands. ##

CVE-2024-53104
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.14%

updated 2024-12-11T15:32:23

4 posts

In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: media: uvcvideo: Skip parsing frames of type UVC_VS_UNDEFINED in uvc_parse_format This can lead to out of bounds writes since frames of this type were not taken into account when calculating the size of the frames buffer in uvc_parse_streaming.

0x40k at 2025-02-28T19:10:02.510Z ##

Whoa, Cellebrite used a zero-day exploit against Android? Seriously? And get this - it was against an activist. As a pentester, I've gotta say, that's seriously messed up. Zero-days are like, the holy grail of vulnerabilities. The vendor's clueless, and attackers? They've got a free pass.

So, jot down these CVE numbers: CVE-2024-53104, CVE-2024-53197, CVE-2024-50302. This just goes to show you how crucial those updates really are! And let's be real, USB ports? Total risk factor.

Makes you wonder, doesn't it? How secure are our phones *really*? And hey, what steps do *you* take to stay protected? Let's chat about it.

#security #pentest #android

##
xairy at 2025-02-28T15:50:23.325Z ##

For CVE-2024-53104 (OOB write in uvc_parse_format), syzbot reaches uvc_parse_streaming — parent function of uvc_parse_format — but fails to get to the bug: syzkaller has no descriptions for streaming interface descriptors.

https://storage.googleapis.com/syzbot-assets/7efefb59364f/ci2-upstream-usb-c749f058.html#drivers%2fmedia%2fusb%2fuvc%2fuvc_driver.c

CVE-2021-41773
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.33%

updated 2024-07-26T21:32:58

1 posts

A flaw was found in a change made to path normalization in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.49. An attacker could use a path traversal attack to map URLs to files outside the expected document root. If files outside of the document root are not protected by "require all denied" these requests can succeed. Additionally this flaw could leak the source of interpreted files like CGI scripts. This issue is known

CVE-2024-1086
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.28%

updated 2024-06-27T12:30:43

1 posts

A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel's netfilter: nf_tables component can be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation. The nft_verdict_init() function allows positive values as drop error within the hook verdict, and hence the nf_hook_slow() function can cause a double free vulnerability when NF_DROP is issued with a drop error which resembles NF_ACCEPT. We recommend upgradi

##

CVE-2024-3400
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 96.26%

updated 2024-04-29T05:02:31

2 posts

A command injection vulnerability in the GlobalProtect feature of Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software for specific PAN-OS versions and distinct feature configurations may enable an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code with root privileges on the firewall. Fixes for PAN-OS 10.2, PAN-OS 11.0, and PAN-OS 11.1 are in development and are expected to be released by April 14, 2024. Cloud NG

Nuclei template

BlackBasta Data Leak Analysis: Tool AV Checks

URLs found which would suggest BlackBasta checking either their samples or other malware against public AV tools. Recommend retrohunt and pivot for any sample hits. Obligatory disclaimer: use caution when interacting with and/or downloading any of these samples. I haven’t extracted IoCs from these samples yet, still triaging the data leak but wanted to share for others to poke at.

##

CVE-2023-38408
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 4.40%

updated 2024-04-19T05:07:56

1 posts

The PKCS#11 feature in ssh-agent in OpenSSH before 9.3p2 has an insufficiently trustworthy search path, leading to remote code execution if an agent is forwarded to an attacker-controlled system. (Code in /usr/lib is not necessarily safe for loading into ssh-agent.) NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2016-10009.

7 repos

https://github.com/wxrdnx/CVE-2023-38408

https://github.com/classic130/CVE-2023-38408

https://github.com/kali-mx/CVE-2023-38408

https://github.com/mrtacojr/CVE-2023-38408

https://github.com/Nick-Morbid/cve-2023-38408

https://github.com/fazilbaig1/cve_2023_38408_scanner

https://github.com/LucasPDiniz/CVE-2023-38408

_r_netsec@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-22T01:43:06.000Z ##

CVE-2023-38408 how to. https://www.vicarius.io/vsociety/posts/exploring-opensshs-agent-forwarding-rce-cve-2023-38408

CVE-2017-18368
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.02%

updated 2024-04-04T00:25:22

1 posts

The ZyXEL P660HN-T1A v1 TCLinux Fw $7.3.15.0 v001 / 3.40(ULM.0)b31 router distributed by TrueOnline has a command injection vulnerability in the Remote System Log forwarding function, which is accessible by an unauthenticated user. The vulnerability is in the ViewLog.asp page and can be exploited through the remote_host parameter.

ntkramer@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-19T22:30:21.000Z ##

🍵 & #threatintel: @greynoise is observing a massive spike in exploitation attempts for CVE-2017-18368, Zyxel Command Injection Vulnerability. The source countries for this spike are pretty diverse; perhaps added to a botnet?

https://viz.greynoise.io/tags/zyxel-router-worm-attempt?days=30

CVE-2023-6875
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 87.95%

updated 2024-01-18T18:30:24

1 posts

The POST SMTP Mailer – Email log, Delivery Failure Notifications and Best Mail SMTP for WordPress plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized access of data and modification of data due to a type juggling issue on the connect-app REST endpoint in all versions up to, and including, 2.8.7. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to reset the API key used to authenticate to the ma

##

CVE-2022-23307
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.48%

updated 2023-10-31T20:58:35

1 posts

CVE-2020-9493 identified a deserialization issue that was present in Apache Chainsaw. Prior to Chainsaw V2.0 Chainsaw was a component of Apache Log4j 1.2.x where the same issue exists. Users are advised to migrate from `log4j:log4j` to `org.apache.logging.log4j:log4j` for an updated version of the library.

3 repos

https://github.com/HynekPetrak/log4shell-finder

https://github.com/logpresso/CVE-2021-44228-Scanner

https://github.com/scopion/ansible-role-cve_2022-23307

oli@social.tchncs.de at 2025-02-27T14:03:06.000Z ##

`[ERROR] log4j-1.2.17.jar: CVE-2020-9493(9.8), CVE-2022-23307(8.8), CVE-2022-23305(9.8), CVE-2019-17571(9.8)`

Ob ihr komplett den Verstand verloren habt, habe ich gefragt!

##

CVE-2022-23305
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.36%

updated 2023-10-31T20:57:34

1 posts

By design, the JDBCAppender in Log4j 1.2.x accepts an SQL statement as a configuration parameter where the values to be inserted are converters from PatternLayout. The message converter, %m, is likely to always be included. This allows attackers to manipulate the SQL by entering crafted strings into input fields or headers of an application that are logged allowing unintended SQL queries to be exe

4 repos

https://github.com/tkomlodi/CVE-2022-23305_POC

https://github.com/HynekPetrak/log4shell-finder

https://github.com/AlphabugX/CVE-2022-RCE

https://github.com/logpresso/CVE-2021-44228-Scanner

oli@social.tchncs.de at 2025-02-27T14:03:06.000Z ##

`[ERROR] log4j-1.2.17.jar: CVE-2020-9493(9.8), CVE-2022-23307(8.8), CVE-2022-23305(9.8), CVE-2019-17571(9.8)`

Ob ihr komplett den Verstand verloren habt, habe ich gefragt!

##

CVE-2019-17571
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 93.85%

updated 2023-10-12T20:41:02

1 posts

Included in Log4j 1.2 is a SocketServer class that is vulnerable to deserialization of untrusted data which can be exploited to remotely execute arbitrary code when combined with a deserialization gadget when listening to untrusted network traffic for log data. This affects Log4j versions 1.2 up to 1.2.17. Users are advised to migrate to `org.apache.logging.log4j:log4j-core`.

4 repos

https://github.com/HynekPetrak/log4shell-finder

https://github.com/Al1ex/CVE-2019-17571

https://github.com/shadow-horse/CVE-2019-17571

https://github.com/hillu/local-log4j-vuln-scanner

oli@social.tchncs.de at 2025-02-27T14:03:06.000Z ##

`[ERROR] log4j-1.2.17.jar: CVE-2020-9493(9.8), CVE-2022-23307(8.8), CVE-2022-23305(9.8), CVE-2019-17571(9.8)`

Ob ihr komplett den Verstand verloren habt, habe ich gefragt!

##

CVE-2018-13313(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.15%

updated 2023-01-30T05:05:55

2 posts

In TOTOLINK A3002RU 1.0.8, the router provides a page that allows the user to change their account name and password. This page, password.htm, contains JavaScript which is used to confirm the user knows their current password before allowing them to change their password. However, this JavaScript contains the current user’s password in plaintext.

iagox86 at 2025-02-27T17:30:25.250Z ##

@cR0w @neurovagrant I found it: "Admin Password returned in password.htm (CVE-2018-13313)"

You can't even invent bugs this stupid

https://blog.securityevaluators.com/new-vulnerabilities-in-totolink-a3002ru-d6f42a081154

CVE-2025-0475
(0 None)

4 posts

kristian@social.purrucker.de at 2025-02-27T20:44:18.000Z ##

Gehts noch GitLab?!? Schon wieder ein Security Patch mit einem CVS Score von 8.7 bei GitLab ihr sagt: „we strongly recommend that all GitLab installations be upgraded to one of these versions immediately“.

Das ist jetzt das vierte (!) mal in diesem Jahr. Das erste mal am 08.01.2025, dann am 22.01.2025, am 12.02.2025 und 26.02.2025.

Ich habe auch noch andere Sachen zu tun, als GitLab Server zu patchen.

#gitlab #security #patch #update #cve #cve20250475

kristian@social.purrucker.de at 2025-02-27T20:44:18.000Z ##

Gehts noch GitLab?!? Schon wieder ein Security Patch mit einem CVS Score von 8.7 bei GitLab ihr sagt: „we strongly recommend that all GitLab installations be upgraded to one of these versions immediately“.

Das ist jetzt das vierte (!) mal in diesem Jahr. Das erste mal am 08.01.2025, dann am 22.01.2025, am 12.02.2025 und 26.02.2025.

Ich habe auch noch andere Sachen zu tun, als GitLab Server zu patchen.

#gitlab #security #patch #update #cve #cve20250475

##
DarkWebInformer@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-20T19:30:35.000Z ##

🚨CVE-2025-27091: OpenH264 Decoding Functions Heap Overflow Vulnerability

https://darkwebinformer.com/cve-2025-27091-openh264-decoding-functions-heap-overflow-vulnerability/

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-20T19:20:29.000Z ##

sev:HIGH heap overflow via race in OpenH264 decoding.

https://github.com/cisco/openh264/security/advisories/GHSA-m99q-5j7x-7m9x

A vulnerability in the decoding functions of OpenH264 codec library could allow a remote, unauthenticated attacker to trigger a heap overflow.

This vulnerability is due to a race condition between a Sequence Parameter Set (SPS) memory allocation and a subsequent non Instantaneous Decoder Refresh (non-IDR) Network Abstraction Layer (NAL) unit memory usage. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by crafting a malicious bitstream and tricking a victim user into processing an arbitrary video containing the malicious bistream. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause an unexpected crash in the victim's user decoding client and, possibly, perform arbitrary commands on the victim's host by abusing the heap overflow.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-27091

##

CVE-2025-27399
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

3 posts

N/A

cR0w at 2025-02-27T18:18:43.973Z ##

Mastodon CVEs, but nothing critical.

https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/security/advisories/GHSA-v39f-c9jj-8w7h

Mastodon is a self-hosted, federated microblogging platform. Starting in version 4.2.0 and prior to versions 4.2.16 and 4.3.4, the rate limits are missing on /auth/setup. Without those rate limits, an attacker can craft requests that will send an email to an arbitrary addresses. Versions 4.2.16 and 4.3.4 fix the issue.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-27157

https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/security/advisories/GHSA-94h4-fj37-c825

Mastodon is a self-hosted, federated microblogging platform. In versions prior to 4.1.23, 4.2.16, and 4.3.4, when the visibility for domain blocks/reasons is set to "users" (localized English string: "To logged-in users"), users that are not yet approved can view the block reasons. Instance admins that do not want their domain blocks to be public are impacted. Versions 4.1.23, 4.2.16, and 4.3.4 fix the issue.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-27399

kpwn@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-26T14:29:02.000Z ##

This resulting HTML is:

kpwn.de/2025/02/cve-2025-12345</span><span class=\"invisible\">6-would-be-parsed-incorectly

And this obviously parses the CVE as CVE-2025-12345 and not CVE-2025-123456.

#CveCrowdDeny

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-26T13:33:21.000Z ##

Here's a sev:HIGH PrivEsc in BeyondTrust Privilege Management for Windows. Something something you had one job something something.

https://www.beyondtrust.com/trust-center/security-advisories/bt25-01

Prior to 25.2, a local authenticated attacker can elevate privileges on a system with Privilege Management for Windows installed, via the manipulation of COM objects under certain circumstances where an EPM policy allows for automatic privilege elevation of a user process.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0889

##

CVE-2025-22881
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

1 posts

N/A

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-26T13:30:41.000Z ##

This vuln is pretty specific but it reminded me to remind y'all that any software that controls any physical processes or manufacturing should be properly segmented from everything else. Related: Don't go installing random firmware in your CNCs and 3d printers. There have been interesting intentional bugs introduced for quite a few years now.

https://filecenter.deltaww.com/news/download/doc/Delta-PCSA-2025-00003_CNCSoft-G2%20-%20Heap-based%20Buffer%20Overflow_v1.pdf

Delta Electronics CNCSoft-G2 lacks proper validation of the length of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a fixed-length heap-based buffer. If a target visits a malicious page or opens a malicious file an attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the current process.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-22881

Infosecurity-Magazine: Essential Addons for Elementor XSS Vulnerability Discovered https://www.infosecurity-magazine.com/news/elementor-plugin-vulnerability-2m/ #cybersecurity #infosec #WordPress

##

CVE-2025-27106
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.05%

1 posts

N/A

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-21T22:18:57.000Z ##

Post-auth command injection in binance-trading-bot. I don't imagine it directly impact most people's jobs but anything to disrupt the cryptocurrency scam market is cool with me.

sev:HIGH 7.7 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:P/PR:L/UI:N/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

https://github.com/chrisleekr/binance-trading-bot/security/advisories/GHSA-wq6j-4388-4gg5

binance-trading-bot is an automated Binance trading bot with trailing buy/sell strategy. Authenticated users of binance-trading-bot can achieve Remote Code Execution on the host system due to a command injection vulnerability in the /restore endpoint. The restore endpoint of binance-trading-bot is vulnerable to command injection via the /restore endpoint. The name of the uploaded file is passed to shell.exec without sanitization other than path normalization, resulting in Remote Code Execution. This may allow any authorized user to execute code in the context of the host machine. This issue has been addressed in version 0.0.100 and all users are advised to upgrade. There are no known workarounds for this vulnerability.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-27106

##

CVE-2025-27092
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.09%

2 posts

N/A

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-20T15:17:44.000Z ##

I honestly don't even know what most of this means or what "an open source user simulation framework for cyber experimentation, simulation, training, and exercise" is, but from what I gather this is a sev:CRIT ../ vuln exploitable by NPCs and that thought entertains me for some reason.

https://github.com/cmu-sei/GHOSTS/security/advisories/GHSA-qr67-m6w9-wj3j

GHOSTS is an open source user simulation framework for cyber experimentation, simulation, training, and exercise. A path traversal vulnerability was discovered in GHOSTS version 8.0.0.0 that allows an attacker to access files outside of the intended directory through the photo retrieval endpoint. The vulnerability exists in the /api/npcs/{id}/photo endpoint, which is designed to serve profile photos for NPCs (Non-Player Characters) but fails to properly validate and sanitize file paths. When an NPC is created with a specially crafted photoLink value containing path traversal sequences (../, ..\, etc.), the application processes these sequences without proper sanitization. This allows an attacker to traverse directory structures and access files outside of the intended photo directory, potentially exposing sensitive system files. The vulnerability is particularly severe because it allows reading arbitrary files from the server's filesystem with the permissions of the web application process, which could include configuration files, credentials, or other sensitive data. This issue has been addressed in version 8.2.7.90 and all users are advised to upgrade. There are no known workarounds for this vulnerability.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-27092

##
DarkWebInformer@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-19T23:07:34.000Z ##

🚨 High Security Vulnerability
🆔 CVE-2025-27092
💣 CVSS Score: 8.7
📅 Published Date: 2025-02-19

⚠️ Details: GHOSTS is an open source user simulation framework for cyber experimentation, simulation, training, and exercise. A path traversal vulnerability was discovered in GHOSTS version 8.0.0.0 that allows an attacker to access files outside of the intended directory through the photo retrieval endpoint. The vulnerability exists in the /api/npcs/{id}/photo endpoint, which is designed to serve profile photos for NPCs (Non-Player Characters) but fails to properly validate and sanitize file paths. When an NPC is created with a specially crafted photoLink value containing path traversal sequences (../, ..\, etc.), the application processes these sequences without proper sanitization. This allows an attacker to traverse directory structures and access files outside of the intended photo directory, potentially exposing sensitive system files. The vulnerability is particularly severe because it allows reading arbitrary files from the server's filesystem with the permissions of the web application process, which could include configuration files, credentials, or other sensitive data. This issue has been addressed in version 8.2.7.90 and all users are advised to upgrade. There are no known workarounds for this vulnerability.

🛠 References:
🔗 GitHub 1: https://github.com/cmu-sei/GHOSTS/security/advisories/GHSA-qr67-m6w9-wj3j
🔗 GitHub 2: https://github.com/cmu-sei/GHOSTS/commit/e69827556a52ff813de00e1017c4b62598d2c887

##
